CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1945, pg. 17, reads: "'Y' Softballers - Members of the Centre Avenue 'Y' Men's Softball team defeated the Alpha Omega team, in a Honus Wagner Metropolitan League game Friday at the R. L. Vann School picnic, by a score of 7 to 2. The team is tied for second place.  Left to right, front row: Larnell Goodman, William McKeever, Harry Huff, Ulysses Davis, William (Muscles) Harris, William Ross, Matthews Thompson, Carl Brown, James Fowler, manager, and Grover Howard.  Back row, standing left to right: Pomeroyal Fountain, physical director, Verne Travis, Clyde Davis, James Fulton, Robert Hamm, Theodore Page, coach; Charles Beard, William Hannon, business manager; Stanley Allen and Herman Hill.  The team plays their home games every Friday at Schenley High Field.  On Friday, June 15, at 6:30 P. M. they will oppose the fast-moving Arlington Indians. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Centre Avenue YMCA softball team, kneeling from left: Larnell Goodman, William McKeever, Harry Huff, Ulysses Davis, William "Muscles" Harris, William Ross, Matthews Thompson, Carl Brown, manager James Fowler, Grover Howard; standing: physical director Pomeroyal Fountain, Verne Travis, Clyde Davis, James Fulton, Robert Hamm, coach Theodore Page, Charles Beard, William Hannon, Stanley Allen, and Herman Hill
